PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mrs. M. Walton, 441 Burrows Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 11, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe youngsters in their early teens, that is from 13 to 16 years of age, should be permitted to smoke cigarettes or drink alcoholic beverages?" answer reads: "I definitely do not believe that these things should be permitted. The first reason is that it is detrimental to the health of the youths.  And I think that smoking and drinking by youths are the first steps leading to juvenile delinquency."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. M. Walton wearing dark hat, earrings, patterned coat with dark collar, holding dark gloves, standing on sidewalk of residential street with trees and reporter holding notepad on right
